definition: Chinese boxing/fist and feet/punching and kicking
fist/boxing
foot/leg (of an animal or an object)/base (of an object)/CL:雙|双[shuang1],隻|只[zhi1]/classifier for kicks
variant of 角[jue2]/role
to square off/to exchange blows/to rain blows on sb

sentences.english: The turbulent meeting ended in a fist fight.
sentences.chinese: 吵鬧的會議最終以拳腳相向而結束。

sentences.english: The two brothers quickly came to blows during their quarrel.
sentences.chinese: 這倆兄弟互相爭吵，很快就變成了拳腳相加。

sentences.english: I was a slave under club and fist.
sentences.chinese: 在他們的棍棒和拳腳下，我就是一個奴隸。

sentences.english: Interestingly, he is still unable to defeat Grey Wolf in a fist fight except for rare incidences.
sentences.chinese: 每逢拳腳之爭，他都還不必然鬥得過灰太狼咧。

sentences.english: Because of bad behavior, his son Ken often impose fist.
sentences.chinese: 因爲行爲惡劣，老唐常遭兒子施以拳腳。

sentences.english: Eventually you will gain the freedom to make a more complete transition.
sentences.chinese: 最終你將獲得大展拳腳的機會來完成更徹底的轉變。

sentences.english: Years of dislike boiled over and blows were exchanged.
sentences.chinese: 多年的厭惡之情終於爆發，雙方拳腳相加。

sentences.english: The injuries were mainly caused by bare-hands, secondly by blunt or sharp at hand.
sentences.chinese: 致傷方式以拳腳爲主，其次爲隨手可得的鈍器或銳器。

sentences.english: The boys had an argument, but it never came to blows.
sentences.chinese: 這些男生有些爭論，但從沒到拳腳相向的程度。

sentences.english: And there was the on-set fight between Japanese and Chinese actors.
sentences.chinese: 在日本演員與中國演員之間也有拳腳相向情況出現。

sentences.english: They fought hard, using every trick. They used their feet and fists as well as their lightsabers.
sentences.chinese: 他們用遍了各種伎倆，除了使用光劍，還拳腳相加。

sentences.english: My father was violent to my mother when he was drunk.
sentences.chinese: 我父親在酒醉時會對我母親拳腳相向。

sentences.english: Yu Xianyang turned and waved fists will be agile, a Japanese doctor.
sentences.chinese: 俞顯揚身手敏捷，轉身揮動拳腳將日本醫生擺平。

sentences.english: Now, however, he has hinted that he may run in 2012.
sentences.chinese: 然而現在，他卻暗示可能會在2012年大展拳腳。

sentences.english: Some of Hu's students demonstrated kung fu routines.
sentences.chinese: 胡政生的幾個學員在相互比劃着功夫拳腳。

sentences.english: A woman, a dog and a walnut tree, the more you beat them, the better they'll be.
sentences.chinese: 拳腳之下出好妻，棍棒之下有義犬，胡桃敲打多結果。

definition: ambition/ambitious
moviedom/the world of movies/film circles
(idiom) fully displaying one's capabilities
venturing from one's thatched hut for the first time (idiom)/young and inexperienced/novice/greenhorn
a common occurrence (idiom)
lit. what the heart wishes, the hand accomplishes (idiom) skilled at the job/entirely in one's element/going smoothly and easily
national
to fight
to have a unique style of one's own (idiom)
to give it your all/to go at it with all you've got/to throw your whole weight behind it/also pr. [hun2 shen1 jie3 shu4]
to excel the common (idiom); surpassing/preeminent/outstanding
lit. veteran of a hundred battles (idiom)/fig. experienced/seasoned
soft power (in international relations)
extremely rare (idiom)/once in a blue moon
variant of 策劃|策划[ce4 hua4]
by fair means or foul/by hook or by crook/unscrupulously
